text: I
it's hard to believe but grilling season
is upon us and today's recipe is great
for all kinds of grilling inside or out
lamb marinated and delicious dil
buttermilk marinade and squash skewers
start by making your marinade to three
quarters of a cup of buttermilk I'm
adding three cloves of garlic pressed
through a garlic press which I really
like to use when i'm looking for a very
fine texture for my garlic you don't
want to end up with little pieces of
garlic in your marinade that will then
burn on the grill to that add a half a
cup of chopped dill did it give it a
stir you want to season this jus so you
want the flavors to really penetrate
into the lamb so season it with some
salt and pepper
and then what I like to do is set aside
some of this marinade for brushing the
kebabs when i grill them you don't need
too much just set that aside for
tomorrow and then add your lamb this is
one and a half pounds of boneless lamb
cut into like 11 and a half inch pieces
and for the best flavor I suggest that
you marinate this overnight in your
refrigerator all right time to kebab it
up I have two zucchini and two summer
squash you could use one or other or
both just like I said I like to cut them
in half lengthwise and then into one and
a half inch chunks the cool thing about
these kebabs is that I'm going to do
kabobs that are just lamb and kebabs
that are just the vegetable I find that
the vegetables and the lamb cooked
better when they're on their own because
well they cook in different amounts of
time so if you're trying to cook squash
and lamb at the same time one of them is
not going to be cooked properly only put
things on kabobs that cook in the same
time otherwise separate them into
different kebabs it's also a really nice
way to serve things thread let's say one
skewer with summer squash make sure that
your grill is preheating at this point
because you want your grill clean hot
and lightly oil it's one skewer of
summer one skewer of zucchini these you
could mix if you wanted to because
they're both squash they're both going
to cook at the same amount of time but
there's something about from a visual
perspective that I like the simplicity
of having only one thing on each skewer
and then lamb same thing I like to leave
a little bit of space between the pieces
of meat I find that it cooks more evenly
that way so don't crush them all on
there you want to put like you know four
or maybe five pieces onto this is an 8
inch skewer for easy transporting just
put them on a baking sheet or something
like that and then continue with your
threading the threading can be done
ahead of time so if you're having a
party and you want to get your skewers
already you can certainly do that keep
them your fridge and then take them out
when you want to start
grilling I think this is plenty on these
skewers these are really nice pieces of
meat so 4 is a lot and then cook I have
my grill preheating already obviously
I'm grilling inside well because we're
inside but you can do this on an outside
grill for sure boil your grill I like to
just use a paper towel to do it and now
the recipe doesn't say to do this but
I'm gonna do it anyway I'm gonna drizzle
my zucchini with just a little bit of
oil there's no fat in this marinade
season and then onto the grill should
take about nine to 12 minutes for the
lamb and maybe up to 15 minutes for the
swatch it really depends my take left
and certainly on an outside grill the
timings are gonna be slightly different
so just keep an eye on stuff and I would
say the squash should be done like on a
medium medium-high heat don't get too
hot because they can run before they
cook through which is really not that
great now while everything is cooking
you can brush it with the reserved
marinade particularly the squash which
don't have any marinade on them you can
give those a little brush and if you
want to right before the lamb comes off
you can brush it with a little bit more
I would wait until it's cooked so you
don't have any cross-contamination
between the clean marinade and the Lambs
if you're not a big fan of lamb you
could certainly replace the laminates
recipe with chicken just as delicious
these look really good you guys it's so
